intro: Desmodium bolsteri, commonly known as the dwarf desmodium, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands or disturbed areas. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Desmodium bolsteri is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial for soil fertility in agricultural settings.
